administrative.name: Final period
administrative.description: 4 blocks (A, B, C, D) each containing 8 main strips (1-8), each divided into 5 micro-plots (01-20).

design.description: 4 blocks (A, B, C, D) each containing 8 main strips (1-8), each divided into 5 micro-plots (01-20).

administrative.name: Early period
administrative.description: Four large blocks each comprising 10 treatment strips. The treatments were applied once every four years. In 1952 two-thirds of the experiment was stopped, although one strip on two blocks we re-incorporated into the experiment later.

design.description: Started by the Education Committee of East Suffolk County Council, to determine how farmyard manure (FYM) and/or inorganic fertilizer (N and P) could best be distributed to crops in a four-course rotation.

administrative.name: Middle period
administrative.description: Rothamsted took over the site in 1964 and modified the experiment. Additional FYM and P was applied to extend the range of P residues prior to testing the value of fresh and residual P on sub-plots within the main treatment strips. Strip 8, which had not received any treatment since 1952 was re-incorporated into the experiment.
